string.description: The mode that you would like to set for the terraform provider. May be set using environment variable `CDK_PROVIDER_MODE`. Can either be one of `console` or `gateway`

The URL of either Conduktor Console or Gateway, depending on the `mode`. May be set using environment variable `CDK_CONSOLE_BASE_URL` or `CDK_BASE_URL` for Console, `CDK_GATEWAY_BASE_URL` or `CDK_BASE_URL` for Gateway. Required either here or in the environment.

The API token to authenticate with the Conduktor Console API. May be set using environment variable `CDK_API_TOKEN` or `CDK_API_KEY`. If not provided, admin_user and admin_password will be used to authenticate. See [documentation](https://docs.conduktor.io/platform/reference/api-reference/#generate-an-api-key) for more information. Not used if `mode` is Gateway.

The login credentials of the admin user. May be set using environment variable `CDK_CONSOLE_USER`, `CDK_ADMIN_EMAIL` or `CDK_ADMIN_USER` for Console, `CDK_GATEWAY_USER` or `CDK_ADMIN_USER` for Gateway. Required if admin_password is set. If not provided and `mode` is Console, the API token will be used to authenticate.

The password of the admin user. May be set using environment variable `CDK_CONSOLE_PASSWORD` or `CDK_ADMIN_PASSWORD` for Console, `CDK_GATEWAY_PASSWORD` or `CDK_ADMIN_PASSWORD` for Gateway. Required if admin_user is set. If not provided, the API token will be used to authenticater.

Root CA certificate in PEM format to verify the Conduktor certificate. May be set using environment variable `CDK_CONSOLE_CACERT` or `CDK_CACERT` for Console, `CDK_GATEWAY_CACERT` or `CDK_CACERT` for Gateway. If not provided, the system's root CA certificates will be used.

bool.description: Skip TLS verification flag. May be set using environment variable `CDK_CONSOLE_INSECURE` or `CDK_INSECURE` for Console, `CDK_GATEWAY_INSECURE` or `CDK_INSECURE` for Gateway.

string.description: Cert in PEM format to authenticate using client certificates. May be set using environment variable `CDK_CONSOLE_CERT` or `CDK_CERT` for Console, `CDK_GATEWAY_CERT` or `CDK_CERT` for Gateway. Must be used with key. If key is provided, cert is required. Useful when Console is behind a reverse proxy with client certificate authentication.

Key in PEM format to authenticate using client certificates. May be set using environment variable `CDK_CONSOLE_KEY` or `CDK_KEY` for Console, `CDK_GATEWAY_KEY` or `CDK_KEY` for Gateway. Must be used with cert. If cert is provided, key is required. Useful when Console is behind a reverse proxy with client certificate authentication.
Group name, must be unique, act as ID for import
Group display name
Group description

set.description: Set of external groups from SSO mapped to this group
Set of members of the group
Set of members of the group

string.description: Name of the resource to apply permission could be a topic, a cluster, a consumer group, etc. depending on resource_type
Type of the resource to apply permission on valid values are: CLUSTER, CONSUMER_GROUP, KAFKA_CONNECT, KSQLDB, PLATFORM, SUBJECT, TOPIC
Name of the cluster to apply permission, only required if resource_type is TOPIC, SUBJECT, CONSUMER_GROUP, KAFKA_CONNECT, KSQLDB
Name of the Kafka Connect to apply permission, only required if resource_type is KAFKA_CONNECT
Type of the pattern to apply permission on valid values are: LITERAL, PREFIXED

set.description: Set of all permissions to apply on the resource. See https://docs.conduktor.io/platform/reference/resource-reference/console/#permissions for more details

string.description: Kafka cluster name, must be unique, acts as an ID for import
Kafka cluster display name
List of bootstrap servers for the Kafka cluster separated by comma
Kafka cluster icon color in hexadecimal format like `#FF0000`
Kafka cluster icon. List of available icons can be found [here](https://docs.conduktor.io/platform/reference/resource-reference/console/#icon-sets)

bool.description: Ignore untrusted certificate for Kafka cluster

string.description:
Schema registry type valid values are: `ConfluentLike`, `Glue`

More detail on our [documentation](https://docs.conduktor.io/platform/reference/resource-reference/console/#schema-registry)
Schema registry URL. Required if type is `ConfluentLike`
Schema registry properties. Only used if type is `ConfluentLike`

bool.description: Ignore untrusted certificate for schema registry. Only used if type is `ConfluentLike`

single_nested.description: Schema registry configuration. Required if type is `ConfluentLike` or `Glue`

string.description:
Schema registry security type. Required if type is `ConfluentLike` or `Glue`.

Valid values are:

- For **ConfluentLike** : `NoSecurity`, `BasicAuth`, `BearerToken`, `SSLAuth` 

- For **Glue** : `Credentials`, `FromContext`, `FromRole`, `IAMAnywhere`

 More detail on our [documentation](https://docs.conduktor.io/platform/reference/resource-reference/console/#schema-registry)
Schema registry basic auth username. Required if security type is `BasicAuth`
Schema registry basic auth password. Required if security type is `BasicAuth`
Schema registry bearer token. Required if security type is `BearerToken`
Schema registry SSL auth private key PEM. Required if security type is `SSLAuth`
Schema registry SSL auth certificate chain PEM. Required if security type is `SSLAuth`
Glue Schema registry AWS access key ID. Required if type is Glue with security `Credentials`
Glue Schema registry AWS secret key. Required if type is Glue with security `Credentials`
Glue Schema registry AWS profile name. Required if type is Glue with security `FromContext`
Glue Schema registry AWS role ARN. Required if type is Glue with security `FromRole`
Glue Schema registry AWS trust anchor ARN. Required if type is Glue with security `IAMAnywhere`
Glue Schema registry AWS profile ARN. Required if type is Glue with security `IAMAnywhere`
Glue Schema registry AWS role ARN. Required if type is Glue with security `IAMAnywhere`
Glue Schema registry AWS certificate. Required if type is Glue with security `IAMAnywhere`
Glue Schema registry AWS private key. Required if type is Glue with security `IAMAnywhere`
Glue Schema registry name. Only used if type is `Glue`
Glue Schema registry AWS region. Required if type is `Glue`
Kafka provider type : `Confluent`, `Aiven`, `Gateway`. More detail on our [documentation](https://docs.conduktor.io/platform/reference/resource-reference/console/#kafka-provider)
Confluent API key. Required if type is `Confluent`
Confluent API secret. Required if type is `Confluent`
Confluent environment identifier. Required if type is `Confluent`
Confluent cluster identifier. Required if type is `Confluent`
Aiven API token. Required if type is `Aiven`
Aiven project name. Required if type is `Aiven`
Aiven service name. Required if type is `Aiven`
Conduktor Gateway Admin API URL. Required if type is `Gateway`
Conduktor Gateway Admin user. Required if type is `Gateway`
Conduktor Gateway Admin password. Required if type is `Gateway`
Conduktor Gateway Virtual cluster name (default `passthrough`). Only used if type is `Gateway`

bool.description: Ignore untrusted certificate for Gateway Admin API. Only used if type is `Gateway`

string.description: Kafka connect server name, must be unique, act as ID for import
Kafka cluster name linked with Kafka current connect server. Must exist in Conduktor Console
Kafka connect server display name
URL of a Kafka Connect cluster. **Multiple URLs are not supported for now**

map.description: Key-Value HTTP headers to add to requests

bool.description: Ignore untrusted certificate for Kafka connect server requests

single_nested.description: Kafka connect server security configuration. One of `BasicAuth`, `BearerToken`, `SSLAuth`

string.description:
Kafka connect server security type. Either `BasicAuth`, `BearerToken`, `SSLAuth`

 More detail on our [documentation](https://docs.conduktor.io/platform/reference/resource-reference/console/#kafkaconnectcluster)
Kafka connect server basic auth username. Required if security type is `BasicAuth`
Kafka connect server basic auth password. Required if security type is `BasicAuth`
Kafka connect server bearer token. Required if security type is `BearerToken`
Kafka connect server mTLS auth private key PEM. Required if security type is `SSLAuth`
Kafka connect server mTLS auth certificate chain PEM. Required if security type is `SSLAuth`
User email, must be unique, act as ID for import
User firstname
User lastname

string.description: The name of the service account, must be unique, act as ID for import
The name of the virtual cluster the service account belongs to. If not provided, the service account will be created in the default passthrough virtual cluster.
The type of the Service Account. Can only be either LOCAL or EXTERNAL.

set.description: Set of the external names of the service account. Required if spec.type is set to EXTERNAL. An external service account should have exactly one external name.

string.description: The name of the virtual cluster to create the token for. If not provided, the token will be created in the default passthrough virtual cluster.
The username of the local service account to create the token for.

int64.description: The life time of the token in milliseconds.
